<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EARNINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/12/analysts-prepare-q2-earnings-releases-without-much-guidance?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Q2 Earnings WIll Be Mysterious
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="The Scooby-Doo gang searching for clues" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/wfOe7SdZ3XyHm/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="The Scooby-Doo gang searching for clues" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/wfOe7SdZ3XyHm/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week, we’ll enter an earnings season that some newsletter writers would call unprecedented if they couldn’t think of another word to describe it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Companies will share how they performed in the second quarter—the three months that featured a coordinated global shutdown of the economy and a reopening attempt that’s going better in some countries than in others. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">High-level: </strong>S&P company earnings are projected to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/10/market-heads-into-worst-earnings-season-in-12-years-amid-worries-virus-is-slowing-recovery.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">decline 44%</a> in Q2, which would be the largest drop since the financial crisis (when they fell 67% in Q4 of 2008). All 11 sectors of the index are expected to post negative earnings. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Here’s the but...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Earnings projections in the coronavirus era are about as useless as rinsing a dish before you put it in the dishwasher. More than 180 S&P companies have <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/wall-streets-earnings-forecast-cloudy-with-a-chance-of-turbulence-11594546201?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pulled earnings guidance</a>, leaving analysts scrambling to figure out ways to determine whether a company hit its goals, given the circumstances. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So unprecedented times calls for unprecedented financial metrics.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Investment pros everywhere are concocting homegrown methodologies and bespoke formulas to help them gauge a company’s health,” </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-08/what-wall-street-pros-will-look-for-this-earnings-season?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes Bloomberg</a></span><span>, whether that’s parsing an exec’s words or evaluating dining trends. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Traditional financial measures like earnings per share are likely to be ignored in favor of broader narratives about companies’ experiences with closing and reopening. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">First up? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As always, it’s the banks. Investment banking should be a bright spot given the surge in trading activity that followed the market crash.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>At one point, daily equity trading volumes in the U.S. increased 90%, </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/d7ab03c2-0939-4665-aa72-a2b922da7310?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the FT</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>JPMorgan predicts a 50% annual increase in markets revenue in Q2.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What won’t be bright spots: </strong>M&A fees, earnings from lending and interest, and larger reserves set aside for loan losses.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Bank stocks significantly trail the S&P 500, which is down only 1.4% this year.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/12/officials-debate-whether-reopen-schools-fall?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Back-to-School Public Health Conundrum
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This week’s Friday Puzzle is early. As back-to-school season approaches...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The U.S.’ working parents </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/02/business/covid-economy-parents-kids-career-homeschooling.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are overwhelmed</a></span><span> and need the flexibility typically provided by schools, especially as some workplaces return to the office. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But COVID-19 cases are still rising in most states, and it may not be safe to send kids back to school.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">There’s no easy solve, but the workforce desperately needs one</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Education Secretary Betsy DeVos <a href="https://www.axios.com/besty-devos-schools-reopen-federal-funds-2d6341f2-c490-4e36-b996-58cf23447087.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pushed for schools</a> to reopen, stressing that “kids cannot afford to not continue learning.” She added that schools that don’t reopen should not get federal funding, a policy President Trump has also suggested. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Public health experts such as former FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb and Dr. Tom Inglesby of Johns Hopkins said the administration </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/devos-defends-push-reopen-schools-trump-admin-accused-messing-children-n1233601?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shouldn’t be pressuring schools</a></span><span> when safety is unclear. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Congressional Democrats oppose the reopening push, too. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the administration is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/education-secretary-devos-renews-call-for-school-reopening-11594568608?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">being reckless</a> in its aggressive approach. When Congress returns next week, No.1 on the to-fight-about list is another coronavirus relief bill, which may include measures to help schools.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COWORKING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/12/wework-cash-flow-positive-2021-says-chairman?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
WeWork: From Punching Bag to Profitable
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="WeWork cleanup" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/QXJbPVNmO9XlYCwH0t/giphy.gif">

<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/6b977ff2-ca5c-449a-bb6b-46039bd26c9b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">an interview</a> with the FT published yesterday, WeWork Executive Chairman Marcelo Claure said the beleaguered coworking company is on track to earn its cash flow positive badge next year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">WeWork has been on a journey. </strong>Last fall, WeWork had Brew writers exhausting We-[insert verb here] puns by <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/30/weworks-ipo-fell-now?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">melting down</a> after an IPO filing revealed sketchy accounting practices and governance. In November, main investor SoftBank stepped in with a $5+ billion bailout. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Claure said he turned the ship around by 1) slashing jobs 2) renegotiating leases and 3) selling assets. So...by making it a smaller ship. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">WeWork had to adjust for COVID-19, too </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some tenants refused to pay or tried to wriggle out of leases. But Claure said revenue has held steady—and that the Great Workplace Revolution has even benefited WeWork. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some companies (including Microsoft, Citigroup, and TikTok owner ByteDance) are turning to WeWork facilities as satellite offices closer to employees’ homes, while some remote workers are using WeWork for shorter slices of the workweek. </p>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/12/paisley-performs-st-louis-parking-lot-part-live-nation-series?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Country star Brad Paisley resisted the urge to stage dive while performing at Live Nation’s first drive-in concert series, “Live From the Drive-In” in St. Louis Friday night. A <a href="https://www.stltoday.com/entertainment/music/kevin-johnson/brad-paisley-assures-were-never-going-to-forget-this-at-drive-in-concert-at-hollywood/article_9a7b2abd-abe0-53fb-9513-aae88cfc16a7.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">review</a> by the St. Louis Post-Dispatch: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Paisley, in his first live show since March, came off especially earnest and thankful for fans who ventured out to see him.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Applause seemed off in this setting, so horn honking was a big deal.”</span></li>
</ul>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/12/week-ahead-july-13?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Week Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We'll learn a lot about COVID-19's effects on the economy this week, from company earnings to important data like June retail sales. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong>PepsiCo earnings</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>Consumer Price Index for June; earnings (Wells Fargo, JPMorgan, Citigroup, Delta); Bastille Day </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>TAX DAY; NBCUniversal’s Peacock streaming service launches nationally; earnings (Goldman Sachs, PNC, UnitedHealth Group, U.S. Bancorp, BNY Mellon)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>June retail sales; earnings (Bank of America, Morgan Stanley, Netflix, Truist Financial, Johnson & Johnson, Abbott Laboratories, Domino’s Pizza)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Housing starts; BlackRock earnings; World Emoji Day</p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As great as WIS (working in sweatpants) is, it’s okay to admit you miss hanging out with your coworkers and just...talking about everyday things.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To recreate some of that fun, Morning Brew built an online <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/madlibz?name=Company+Party+Shenanigans&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mad Libz</a> game to help you connect. You can choose from various situations—including “company party shenanigans”—to form a story that simultaneously makes no sense and all the sense in the world.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span class="c-mrkdwn__br" data-stringify-type="paragraph-break"></span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/madlibz?name=Company+Party+Shenanigans&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Try out the game</a>, then get your entire office playing.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Learn more about investing: </strong>WSJ columnist Jason Zweig has an <a href="https://jasonzweig.com/stop-worrying-and-learn-to-love-the-bear/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">entire website</a> devoted to blogs, resources, and books around investing. His first column came out 12 years ago yesterday and it remains relevant today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Productivity workshop:</strong> Join the Brew and entrepreneur Nir Eyal for a 2-week workshop helping you prioritize your time and become a less distracted, more productive person. <a href="https://www.nirandfar.com/becoming-indistractable/?partner=morningbrew&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=partner&utm_campaign=mb_course_0701&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn more here</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Boost your mornings: </strong>We know a good newsletter when we see one, and The Newsette consistently delivers. You'll get news, tips, and interviews that will inspire you to win the day in under five minutes. <a href="https://thenewsette.com/mb/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=cross_promo&utm_campaign=Morning_Brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check it out here</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Hodgepodge of interesting stories: </strong>The <a href="https://www.quantamagazine.org/the-tricky-math-of-covid-19-herd-immunity-20200630/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tricky math</a> of herd immunity. Why so many people in China pick “<a href="https://yiqinfu.github.io/posts/chinese-people-weird-english-names/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">weird</a>” English names for themselves. And <a href="https://www.newyorker.com/culture/culture-desk/the-gay-marriages-of-a-nineteenth-century-prison-ship" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">19th-century gay marriages</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Start Talking
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>On Mondays, we'll present some of the thorniest business topics of the day, give you a jumping-off point with resources, and encourage you to debate it with friends, family, and coworkers. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Today’s topic:</strong> Let's run it back to one of our stories—should schools reopen? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>When schools are reopening and what that may look like. (</span><span><a href="https://www.thecut.com/2020/07/will-schools-open-in-the-fall-reopening-statuses-explained.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Cut</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Lessons from reopening schools abroad. (</span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/07/10/889842725/lessons-on-reopening-schools-the-u-s-could-learn-from-germany-israel-and-thailan?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NPR</a></span><span>, </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/europe/schools-reopening-coronavirus/2020/07/10/865fb3e6-c122-11ea-8908-68a2b9eae9e0_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WaPo</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Teachers are being forced to choose between health and their jobs. (</span><span><a href="https://time.com/5864158/coronavirus-teachers-school/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Time</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Why one epidemiologist thinks schools should reopen. (</span><span><a href="https://www.vox.com/2020/7/9/21318560/covid-19-coronavirus-us-testing-children-schools-reopening-questions?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vox</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Students need schools to reopen, but it’s going to take $$$. (</span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/10/opinion/coronavirus-schools-reopening.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT Editorial Board</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Nonmedical vaccine exemptions and school liability could complicate things further. (</span><span><a href="https://www.educationdive.com/news/will-schools-mandate-covid-19-vaccine-or-face-liability/580893/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Education Dive</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>

width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis week, we’ll enter an earnings season that some newsletter writers would call unprecedented if they couldn’t think of another word to describe it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCompanies will share how they performed in the second quarter—the three months that featured a coordinated global shutdown of the economy and a reopening attempt that’s going better in some countries than in others. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHigh-level: \u003c/strong\u003eS\u0026P company earnings are projected to \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/10/market-heads-into-worst-earnings-season-in-12-years-amid-worries-virus-is-slowing-recovery.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edecline 44%\u003c/a\u003e in Q2, which would be the largest drop since the financial crisis (when they fell 67% in Q4 of 2008). All 11 sectors of the index are expected to post negative earnings. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHere’s the but...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarnings projections in the coronavirus era are about as useless as rinsing a dish before you put it in the dishwasher. More than 180 S\u0026P companies have \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/wall-streets-earnings-forecast-cloudy-with-a-chance-of-turbulence-11594546201?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epulled earnings guidance\u003c/a\u003e, leaving analysts scrambling to figure out ways to determine whether a company hit its goals, given the circumstances. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo unprecedented times calls for unprecedented financial metrics.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“Investment pros everywhere are concocting homegrown methodologies and bespoke formulas to help them gauge a company’s health,” \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-08/what-wall-street-pros-will-look-for-this-earnings-season?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, whether that’s parsing an exec’s words or evaluating dining trends. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTraditional financial measures like earnings per share are likely to be ignored in favor of broader narratives about companies’ experiences with closing and reopening. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFirst up? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs always, it’s the banks. Investment banking should be a bright spot given the surge in trading activity that followed the market crash.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAt one point, daily equity trading volumes in the U.S. increased 90%, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/d7ab03c2-0939-4665-aa72-a2b922da7310?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the FT\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJPMorgan predicts a 50% annual increase in markets revenue in Q2.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat won’t be bright spots: \u003c/strong\u003eM\u0026A fees, earnings from lending and interest, and larger reserves set aside for loan losses.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBank stocks significantly trail the S\u0026P 500, which is down only 1.4% this year.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut COVID-19 cases are still rising in most states, and it may not be safe to send kids back to sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThere’s no easy solve, but the workforce desperately needs one\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Education Secretary Betsy DeVos \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/besty-devos-schools-reopen-federal-funds-2d6341f2-c490-4e36-b996-58cf23447087.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epushed for schools\u003c/a\u003e to reopen, stressing that “kids cannot afford to not continue learning.” She added that schools that don’t reopen should not get federal funding, a policy President Trump has also suggested. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePublic health experts such as former FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb and Dr. Tom Inglesby of Johns Hopkins said the administration \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/donald-trump/devos-defends-push-reopen-schools-trump-admin-accused-messing-children-n1233601?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshouldn’t be pressuring schools\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e when safety is unclear. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCongressional Democrats oppose the reopening push, too. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the administration is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/education-secretary-devos-renews-call-for-school-reopening-11594568608?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeing reckless\u003c/a\u003e in its aggressive approach. When Congress returns next week, No.1 on the to-fight-about list is another coronavirus relief bill, which may include measures to help schools.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/09/30/weworks-ipo-fell-now?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emelting down\u003c/a\u003e after an IPO filing revealed sketchy accounting practices and governance. But Claure said revenue has held steady—and that the Great Workplace Revolution has even benefited WeWork. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome companies (including Microsoft, Citigroup, and TikTok owner ByteDance) are turning to WeWork facilities as satellite offices closer
